Class FinsembleBridge

This is the Main Class used to access Finsemble in a .NET Application. Once connected, several Finsemble APIs can be used using the SendCommand method. Connecting to Finsemble:

/*windowName, componentType and uuid are provided as command line parameters when the application is launched by Finsemble*/
var finsemble = new FinsembleBridge(openFinVersion, windowName, componentType, window, uuid);
finsemble.Connect += Finsemble_Connected;

Using the Clients once connected:

private void Finsemble_Connected(object sender, EventArgs e) {
    finsemble.SendCommand("LinkerClient.publish", new JObject {
        ["dataType"] = "symbol",
        ["data"] = "AAPL"
    });
}

Constructors

FinsembleBridge(Version, String, String, Window, String)

Initializes a new instance of the FinsembleBridge class. This is how you interact with Finsemble. All the clients will be part of the bridge.

Declaration
public FinsembleBridge(Version openFinVersion, string windowName, string componentType, Window window, string uuid)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Version openFinVersion

The version of the OpenFin runtime to which to connect
System.String windowName

The windowName parameter passed as a command line parameter when launched from Finsemble.
System.String componentType

The componentType parameter passed as a command line parameter when launched from Finsemble.
System.Windows.Window window

The window that will be Finsembleized
System.String uuid

The uuid parameter passed as a command line parameter when launched from Finsemble.

OpenFinVersion

public Version OpenFinVersion { get; }

Type Description
System.Version
Remarks

Version must match the version of OpenFin used by Finsemble for inter-application communication to be possible.
